content.raw:
The keyboard shortcuts are nice for switching between modes. Could we add a key for switching back to Select mode? Should it be the escape key?

Also, there's some strange behavior if you're inserting a new box or sphere, and then you switch modes with the keyboard shortcuts. The visual for the new box / sphere remains and can be resized but disappears once you try to insert another object.
content.html:
The keyboard shortcuts are nice for switching between modes. Could we add a key for switching back to Select mode? Should it be the escape key?

Also, there's some strange behavior if you're inserting a new box or sphere, and then you switch modes with the keyboard shortcuts. The visual for the new box / sphere remains and can be resized but disappears once you try to insert another object.

content.raw: One more issue for you to look at. Insert a mesh (I used the cube_20k model). Select the model for translation. Then use View->Transparent. At this point I can translate along the z-axis, but I can't select the x or y arrows (the portions of the arrow that are in the cube).
content.html: One more issue for you to look at. Insert a mesh (I used the cube_20k model). Select the model for translation. Then use View->Transparent. At this point I can translate along the z-axis, but I can't select the x or y arrows (the portions of the arrow that are in the cube).

content.raw:
Translation problem 1: Select an object using the translate tool. Then click and drag anywhere on the screen. The object will move, even if the cursor is not over the object.

Translation problem 2: Select an object using the translate tool. Hold down x, y, or z key. Click and drag on a different object. The other object will move. This is problematic when trying to precisely place object that slightly overlap. I would expect the first selected object to stay active if I have x,y, or z key pressed.
content.html:
Translation problem 1: Select an object using the translate tool. Then click and drag anywhere on the screen. The object will move, even if the cursor is not over the object.

Translation problem 2: Select an object using the translate tool. Hold down x, y, or z key. Click and drag on a different object. The other object will move. This is problematic when trying to precisely place object that slightly overlap. I would expect the first selected object to stay active if I have x,y, or z key pressed.

content.raw: I think this is a good thing to support in the future. When a model is scaled, the link cog locations and joint anchors re-position themselves accordingly. We also need to decided whether inertial properties should change or not. But for now scaling will just apply to simple shapes.
content.html: I think this is a good thing to support in the future. When a model is scaled, the link cog locations and joint anchors re-position themselves accordingly. We also need to decided whether inertial properties should change or not. But for now scaling will just apply to simple shapes.

pull_request.title: New user interaction method and resize functionality

pullrequest.title: New user interaction method and resize functionality

content.raw: My primary concern about adding the `scale` variable to entities other than shapes is the effect it might have on physics, like center of gravity location and joints. It seems helpful for dynamically resizing things individual shapes (collisions & visuals), but it will make the physics more complicated if applied to links and models.
content.html: My primary concern about adding the scale variable to entities other than shapes is the effect it might have on physics, like center of gravity location and joints. It seems helpful for dynamically resizing things individual shapes (collisions & visuals), but it will make the physics more complicated if applied to links and models.

pull_request.title: New user interaction method and resize functionality

pullrequest.title: New user interaction method and resize functionality

content.raw: I have the idea that if you call set scale on high level entities such as model, links, it should scale its children relative to the parent origin. The scale variable is convenient because we can check that to make sure we don't apply the same scale more than once.
content.html: I have the idea that if you call set scale on high level entities such as model, links, it should scale its children relative to the parent origin. The scale variable is convenient because we can check that to make sure we don't apply the same scale more than once.

content.raw: This pull request adds a private member variable `double scale` to the `physics::Shape` and `physics::Entity` classes. Scale makes sense to me for the Shapes. I'm wondering what it will mean for Entities, such as models, links, collisions, and visuals.
content.html: This pull request adds a private member variable double scale to the physics::Shape and physics::Entity classes. Scale makes sense to me for the Shapes. I'm wondering what it will mean for Entities, such as models, links, collisions, and visuals.

content.raw: The resize feature doesn't seem to work properly with all multi-link models. I tested it by pausing physics and inserting a double pendulum with base and a polaris and stretching vertically. For the double pendulum, some of the horizontal cylinders were extended horizontally instead of vertically.
content.html: The resize feature doesn't seem to work properly with all multi-link models. I tested it by pausing physics and inserting a double pendulum with base and a polaris and stretching vertically. For the double pendulum, some of the horizontal cylinders were extended horizontally instead of vertically.
